subject: Re: How to unit test Eclipse Plugin and RCP?
msgSnippet: I have a similar machine 2.4Ghz pentium m , 1 gb ram . I experience similar startup times . And to me the wait is worth it ,since i am not mocking out platform
messageBody:
I have a similar machine 2.4Ghz pentium m , 1 gb ram . I experience
similar startup times . And to me the wait is worth it ,since i am
not mocking out platform stuff and be sure that it "really" worked .
I never have that kind of confidence when i mock out stuff.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Mark Levison" <mlevison@...> wrote:
>
> On 9/21/06, Tim Hardy <yahoo@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > > BTW as bad as the Eclipse startup time is its not the end of
the world
> > 5-12
> > > secs on my machine (guess it depends on what Windows has
cached).
> >
> > Just out of interest, would you mind sharing the specs of your
machine?
> > My desktop is pretty old - a 1.8G P4 with 768M of ram - and
launching
> > the runtime workbench takes 30-35 seconds. (I'm running Debian
but I
> > assume it's the hardware not the OS that's making the
difference. Like
> > all assumptions, this may be wrong.)
>
>
> My machine is 1yr old: P4 3.6Ghz with 3 GB of RAM. OS Windows XP
SP2.
>
> Mark
> -------------------------------------------------------------------
---
> Blog: http://www.notesfromatooluser.com/
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
